sentences.en: Bethune threw the saw away with distaste.
sentences.cn: 白求恩厌恶地把锯子扔在一边.

sentences.en: Hagen was watching him with his mouth curled up with distaste.
sentences.cn: 黑根噘起嘴,很反感地打量着他.

sentences.en: He fingered my report with evident distaste.
sentences.cn: 他带着明显厌恶的心情翻阅着我的报告.

sentences.en: He looked around the filthy room in distaste.
sentences.cn: 他厌恶地环顾着这肮脏的房间。

sentences.en: He noted with distaste his own trick of appealing for sympathy.
sentences.cn: 他发觉自己又在卖弄乞求同情的花招,感到非常恶心.

sentences.en: He professed a distaste for everything related to money.
sentences.cn: 他声称厌恶与金钱有关的一切。

sentences.en: He professed a violent distaste for everything related to commerce, production, and money.
sentences.cn: 他对一切与商业、生产和金钱相关的东西表示了强烈的厌恶。

sentences.en: I yield to no one in my personal distaste for discrimination.
sentences.cn: 我本人厌恶歧视,这一点我对任何人都不让步.

sentences.en: Jordan changed the subject with an urban distaste for the concrete.
sentences.cn: 乔丹带有一种城里人不愿说出具体细节的态度,回避了话题.

sentences.en: Roger looked at her with distaste.
Rudolph looked at the neatly typed report with distaste.
sentences.cn: 鲁道夫厌恶地望着打字清晰的报告.

sentences.en: She grimaced in / with distaste at the thought of it.
sentences.cn: 她一想到那个就厌恶得作怪相.

sentences.en: She looked at his shabby clothes with distaste.
sentences.cn: 她有些厌恶地看着他那一身寒酸的衣服.

sentences.en: She looked back with distaste to her only two visits to London.
sentences.cn: 她索然无味地回顾她对伦敦仅有的两次访问.

sentences.en: Stifling his distaste, Miles undressed the old man.
sentences.cn: 迈尔斯强忍住厌恶, 给老家伙脱下衣服.

words.tran_cn: 令人不快的；不合口味的；表示厌恶的

trans.tran_en: a feeling that something or someone is unpleasant or morally offensive
